Results.TAoC Follow-up: Your spirometry (lung function test) shows a restrictive pattern. However, this test has a high incidence of false positive, which may be due to suboptimal technique. A repeat test is recommended. A restrictive pattern may be due to underlying lung conditions, such as pulmonary fibrosis and cystic fibrosis, which cause lung scarring. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice if you have respiratory symptoms and poor exercise tolerance.

Your spirometry (lung function test) shows an obstructive pattern. However, this test has a high incidence of false positive, which may be due to suboptimal technique. A repeat test is recommended. An obstructive pattern is commonly associated with smoking and asthma. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice if you have respiratory symptoms and poor exercise tolerance.

Your spirometry (lung function test) shows a restrictive with obstructive pattern. However, this test has a high incidence of false positive, which may be due to suboptimal technique. A repeat test is recommended. A restrictive pattern may be due to underlying lung conditions, such as pulmonary fibrosis and cystic fibrosis, which cause lung scarring. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice if you have respiratory symptoms and poor exercise tolerance.

Your spirometry (lung function test) shows an obstructive with restrictive pattern. However, this test has a high incidence of false positive, which may be due to suboptimal technique. A repeat test is recommended. An obstructive pattern is commonly associated with smoking and asthma. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice if you have respiratory symptoms and poor exercise tolerance.

Your audiogram shows high frequency hearing loss, which is usually associated with ageing and prolonged exposure to loud sounds. This is also seen in people with diabetes. Annual audiograms are recommended. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice if you experience perceived hearing loss, tinnitus, ear pain, or any other ear-related symptoms.

Your audiogram shows bilateral hearing loss, which is usually associated with ageing and prolonged exposure to loud sounds. Annual audiograms are recommended. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
